verses.text: The LORD is King for ever and ever; the nations will perish from his land.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 10
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 10 This psalm has no title. In its original form, it was likely combined with Ps. 9 (see above on Ps. 9). Taken separately the psalm would be an individual lament, bemoaning the wicked who victimize the righteous and calling on God to restore justice.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 10:16
rsbNotes.text:
10:16 king. God is covenant Lord; see Introduction: Characteristics and Themes.

nations. Those who worship other gods and persecute God’s people.

verses.text: You hear, O LORD, the desire of the afflicted; you encourage them, and you listen to their cry,
defending the fatherless and the oppressed, in order that man, who is of the earth, may terrify no more.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 10:17–18
rsbNotes.text: 10:17, 18 justice to the fatherless. The lament concludes with a strong statement of trust in God, who delivers the weak from oppression. Men terrify, but God overrules the wickedness in men.
